info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 7:26PM CDT until July 18 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Frio River Near Derby affecting Frio County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Frio River near Derby.
* WHEN...From late tonight to late Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding reaches the Farm to Market 1581 bridge floor.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 6.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon by 130 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING
